title: Internal compiler error - tuple_fields called on non-tuple

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust use std::collections::HashMap; fn main() { let mut res: HashMap> = HashMap::new(); let masks: Vec = (0..=0xffffu16).filter(|&x| false).to_owned().collect(); for &x in masks.iter() { res.insert(x, masks.iter().filter(|&y| false).collect()); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.49.0-nightly (ffa2e7ae8 2020-10-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: ffa2e7ae8fbf9badc035740db949b9dae271c29f commit-date: 2020-10-24 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.49.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling pe237 v0.1.0 (/Users/dnnx/work/competitions/projecteuler/pe237) error[E0277]: a value of type `Vec` cannot be built from an iterator over elements of type `&u16` --> src/main.rs:9:55 | 9 | res.insert(x, masks.iter().filter(|&y| false).collect()); | ^^^^^^^ value of type `Vec` cannot be built from `std::iter::Iterator` | = help: the trait `FromIterator<&u16>` is not implemented for `Vec` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/sty.rs:2150:18: tuple_fields called on non-tuple thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:945:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.49.0-nightly (ffa2e7ae8 2020-10-24) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `[closure@src/main.rs:6:50: 6:60]: std::clone::Clone` #1 [typeck] type-checking `main` end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`. error: could not compile `pe237` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

Note: when I remove `.to_owned()` from the source code, the internal compiler error goes away, so it must be connected. Don't look at the source code too closely. ~I don't know what I am doing.~ UPDATE: I removed irrelevant stuff from the original code and updated the compiler output accordingly in the issue description.
